Moving Newtowrk Indicators to the Left

This is a much easier process than you think!

  1. Select the option in K-Manager to move the network indicators to the left.
  2. Tap the yellow build button at the bottom left corner of K-Manager.
  3. Install K-Klock once it\'s been built.
  4. Open K-Klock in substratum and build the clock that you want, don\'t worry about not being able to find any option for the left indicators!
  5. Reboot or restart SystemUI and watch as your network indicators move to the left.

If this guide has been unclear in any way, let me know so I can fix it

FAQ\'s

  • I\'ve installed K-Manager but I can\'t find anything in substratum???

    Make sure that you have built of the K-Klock apk! If you haven\'t, tap the yellow build button at the bottom right corner of K-Manager and install K-Klock when prompted.

  • How do I move the my custom clock format to the right/left/center of the statusbar?

    Open K-Klock in substratum and tap on the \'Clock Style\' option. Here you can select the clock position.
    You can also choose whether to keep the clock visible on your lockscreen or not!

    The White-Grey option lets you install a dynamically changing clock just like the stock one.

  • I want to add a custom format but it\'s not working?

    I\'d recommend reading this XDA Thread first. After that, ask in my thread and I\'ll help you out!

FAQ\'s

About other Roms

  • This option modifies the xml files necessary to create K-Klock on the go
  • Unfortunately, these xml files are different for each Rom
  • Since I don\'t have the xml files from every Rom, you\'ll have to provide these yourself
  • Below is an easy step-by-step guide that anyone should be able to follow

How to make the Other Roms option work

  1. Download an apk decompiler

    I would recommend Apk Editor It\'s faster than using a Pc for everything.

  2. Find and decompile your Roms SystemUI.apk

    If you\'re not rooted you\'re going to need a Pc for this part. Make sure you have Adb Drivers installed on your Pc (Google how). Open up a command terminal and type:

    1. adb pull /system/priv-app/SystemUI/SystemUI.apk
    2. adb push SystemUI.apk /sdcard/

    You should now have a file called SystemUI.apk in your internal storage.

    Now for the decompiling! Open up Apk Editor.

    • If you\'re rooted select an Apk from App. Then tap the three dots at the top to find system apps. Now search for System UI and decompile with Full Edit.
    • If you aren\'t rooted select Apk from File. Then search System UI and you\'ll find the file that you adb\'d before. Decompile this with Full Edit.

    Now select Files at the bottom of Apk Editor

  3. Exctracting the files

    Now navigate to res -> layout and select the following three xml\'s:

    • keyguard_status_bar.xml
    • status_bar.xml
    • system_icons.xml

    Then use the Extract option at the bottom to extract the xmls to K-Klock/userInput (case-sensitive).

  4. Chill Out!

    Now open K-Manager and start changing stuff! You won\'t have to repeat this process unless those files are deleted.

I have tried to make this guide as clear as possible but if you haveany ideas on how to improve it, Let me know
